original: Jung, Ingvar Karl Einar, tekn. dr, mariningenjör, fd. professor, Finspång, f. 9/3/10 i Sithlm av dir. Torsten J. o. Gärda Lyttkens. G. 1. 36 m. Karin Blomqvist, d. 40; 2. 41 m. Heidi Seeger. Barn: Bertil f. 36, Birgitta 40, Ingela 43, Gunilla 45. — Stud:ex. i Jönköp. 28, utex. fr. KTH 32, tekn. dr 36. Marining :stip. 32, anst. h. Brow^n Boveri i Baden, May-bach Motorenv^erke i Friedrichshafen, Schiffbauversuchsianst. i ’ Ham’burg, Penhoét i S :t Nazaire, British Thomson Houston i Rugby samt A-B de Lavals Åmgturbin i Sthlm 32-34, v. ör-loigsvarvet i Karlskr. samt sjötjänst 34-36, ing. v. Brown Boveri i Baden 36- 3(9, miarin:ens kontr. f. kust- o. stads-jagarna sam’t kryssarna v. n^djyggn :-centr. i Gbg 39-43, kallad t. prof. i ång-tekn. v. CTH s. å., örvering. v. Götaverken 44-46, anst. v. STAL i Finspång sed. 47. Led. av Sv. tekn:-fören. sed. 34. Skr.: Wärmeübergang und Reibungswiderstand bei Gasströ-mungien in Rohren bei h olien Ge-schwtindiiigkeiten (grad: avh. 36) samt art. i tidn. o. tidskr.
translated: Jung, Ingvar Karl Einar, PhD, naval engineer, former professor, from Finspång, born on March 9, 1910 in Sithlm, son of director Torsten J. and Gärda Lyttkens. Married 1st in 1936 to Karin Blomqvist, who died in 1940, and 2nd in 1941 to Heidi Seeger. Children: Bertil born in 1936, Birgitta in 1940, Ingela in 1943, and Gunilla in 1945. He completed his matriculation examination in Jönköping in 1928 and graduated from KTH in 1932 with an engineering degree, followed by his PhD in 1936. He was a recipient of the naval engineering scholarship in 1932 and was employed by Brown Boveri in Baden, Maybach Motors in Friedrichshafen, Schiffbauversuchsanstalt in Hamburg, Penhoét in St. Nazaire, British Thomson Houston in Rugby, and A-B de Lavals Ångturbin in Stockholm between 1932 and 1934. He also served in the navy from 1934 to 1936 and then worked as an engineer for Brown Boveri in Baden from 1936 to 1939. He was the naval engineering contractor for coastal and urban hunters and cruisers at the construction center in Gothenburg from 1939 to 1943. He was appointed professor of steam technology at KTH in the same year and transferred to Göteborg shipyard from 1944 to 1946. He was employed by STAL in Finspång since 1947. He has been a member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1934 and has written the thesis "Wärmeübergang und Reibungswiderstand bei Gasströmungen in Rohren bei hohen Geschwindigkeiten" (1936) and articles in various journals.

structured.name: Ingvar Karl Einar Jung
structured.description: Ingvar Karl Einar Jung (1910-03-09 - Unknown) was a Swedish naval engineer and former professor. He was born in Sithlm to director Torsten J. and Gärda Lyttkens. He was married twice, first to Karin Blomqvist, who died in 1940, and then to Heidi Seeger in 1941. He had four children named Bertil, Birgitta, Ingela, and Gunilla. He completed his matriculation examination in Jönköping in 1928 and graduated from KTH in 1932 with an engineering degree, followed by his PhD in 1936. He has worked for various organizations such as Brown Boveri, Maybach Motors, Schiffbauversuchsanstalt, Penhoét, and British Thomson Houston. He has also served in the navy and has been a contractor for coastal and urban hunters and cruisers. He was also appointed professor of steam technology at KTH in 1943 and later transferred to Göteborg shipyard. He has been a member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1934 and has written a thesis titled Wärmeübergang und Reibungswiderstand bei Gasströmungen in Rohren bei hohen Geschwindigkeiten and articles in various journals.
